articles.title: Quadrantid meteor shower: When and where to see UK's first meteor shower of 2023 - Liverpool Echo
articles.description: Up to 110 meteors an hour could be seen in the sky over the UK this evening
articles.content:
The first meteor shower of 2023 is expected to light up the skies tonight.
Up to 110 meteors an hour could be seen in the sky over the UK as the Quadrantid meteor shower makes an appearance on Janua… [+2037 chars]

articles.title: NASA is looking for a solution with SpaceX to rescue astronauts from the ISS due to a leak on Soyuz spacecraft - AIRLIVE
articles.description: Three residents of the International Space Station are facing an uncertain future after a Russian Soyuz capsule sprung a dramatic coolant leak last month.
articles.content: Three residents of the International Space Station are facing an uncertain future after a Russian Soyuz capsule sprung a dramatic coolant leak last month that has left the craft’s spaceworthiness in … [+772 chars]

articles.title: South Korea's lunar orbiter sends photos of Earth and the moon - Daily Mail
articles.description: Danuri, a portmanteau of the Korean words for 'moon' and 'enjoy', was launched on a SpaceX rocket from the US in August 2022 and entered lunar orbit last month.
articles.content:
South Korea's first-ever lunar orbiter has sent back stunning black-and-white photos of the moon's surface and Earth.

articles.title: ‘We’re in a space race’: Nasa sounds alarm at Chinese designs on moon - The Guardian
articles.description: Administrator Bill Nelson says Beijing could seek ‘own’ resource-rich areas and next two years could be key to US-China contest
articles.content:
The US is locked in a space race with China and the country needs to watch out that its rival does not gain a foothold and try to dominate lunar resources, Nasas top official has warned.
